newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Gang dispute in Indonesian capital closes shops.
newsitem.headline: Gang dispute in Indonesian capital closes shops.

text.p: A territorial dispute between two gangs in the central Jakarta district of Tanah Abang closed a busy market after an early morning confrontation on Thursday, residents said.
Witnesses said around 100 troops and police had closed streets around the market in the Indonesian capital but the area appeared calm and under control. There were no immediate reports of damage
Police from the Tanah Abang district confirmed the incident involved a gang dispute but were unable immediately to give any details.
News of the dispute spread quickly through Jakarta's financial markets, which have reacted to recent riots and demonstrations in Indondsia.
Shop owners in Tanah Abang quickly closed their stores as a precaution after the early morning confrontation between the two gangs.
The owners said the two gangs, one consisting of ethnic East Timorese men and the other made up of ethnic Irianese, were fighting for territorial control of the district.
Tanah Abang, an important area for the textile trade in Jakarta and home to a number of local banks, is also known for its cheap accommodation and its red-light district.
